newsitem.title: USA: Dow Jones jumps as two investors buy stake.
newsitem.headline: Dow Jones jumps as two investors buy stake.

text.p: Shares of Dow Jones & Co jumped about six percent Wednesday following news that two heavyweight investors -- Michael Price and James Cramer -- had acquired a small stake in the media company.
Dow Jones gained 2-1/4 to 37-3/4 in morning trading.
Price, known for spurring lackluster companies to improve their finances, now holds a 4.7 percent stake in Dow Jones. Cramer, who manages a private investment fund, holds a one percent stake.
Spokesmen for Price and Cramer declined comment on the matter.
Their stock purchases were reported by the Wall Street Journal, which is published by Dow Jones.
